references.paper_title: Graph neural networks: A review of methods and applications
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of graph neural networks (GNNs), which is the primary method used by the authors and thus provides the background for understanding GNNs.
This paper introduces generalized additive models (GAMs), which are the basis for the proposed GNAN model in this paper and provides its interpretability.

references.paper_title: A unified approach to interpreting model predictions
references.reason: This paper is a seminal work on model interpretability and is used in this paper to explain the interpretability of GNAN.
This paper introduces graph attention networks (GAT), a commonly used GNN architecture, which is used as a baseline for comparison in this paper.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces GraphSAGE, another commonly used GNN architecture, which is used as a baseline for comparison in this paper.
